title: Isolate Terms with T
text: The first step in solving an equation in this form is to combine all terms with the variable $$t$$ on one side.

title: Subtract $$t$$ term
text: To isolate, subtract both sides by the term $$e^2 t$$. Both terms have the same exponent, so their coefficients can be subtracted like normal.

title: Dividing by Coefficient
text: Next step in solving is to divide both sides by the coefficient of the term with $$e^2 t$$.

title: Dividing by Constant
text: What is the value of the left hand side of the equation when dividing by the coefficient of the $$e^2 t$$ term?

title: Variable in Exponent
text: To get the variable out of the exponent, take the natural log of both sides.

title: Inverse Functions
text: Since ln(x) and $$e^x$$ are inverse functions, taking the natural log of a term with e leaves only the exponent left.

title: Isolate $$t$$
text: To isolate $$t$$ by itself, divide both sides by the coefficient of $$t$$.
